text: Randy Andreachuk (born July 19, 1954) is a Canadian former professional ice hockey player. He played in two World Hockey Association games with the Winnipeg Jets during the 1974–75 season. His National Hockey League rights were traded in 1974 by the Philadelphia Flyers to the St. Louis Blues, along with a draft pick, in exchange for Wayne Stephenson. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1954 births Category:Calgary Centennials players Category:Canadian ice hockey centres Category:Ice hockey people from Alberta Category:Kamloops Chiefs players Category:Living people Category:Medicine Hat Tigers players Category:Philadelphia Flyers draft picks Category:Roanoke Valley Rebels (SHL) players Category:San Diego Mariners (PHL) players Category:Sportspeople from Lethbridge Category:Winnipeg Jets (WHA) draft picks Category:Winnipeg Jets (WHA) players Category:Winston-Salem Polar Twins (SHL) players Category:World Hockey Association first round draft picks
title: Randy Andreachuk
